page.title: 08NORTON SEWAGE WORKS.
page.content: At present Norton and Campsall are served by a fairly small sewage works serving 3800 people and Askern and Sutton by a 65 year old works serving 5700 people. Both systems are oversubscribed and therefore prevent either industrial or housing develop- ment. In 1980 the {YORKSHIRE WATER {AUTHORITY} decided to build a new sewage treatment plant at Norton to replace the two existing plants. Sewage from Askern will be pumped to the new system at Norton and the new system will enable to capacity to be increased to serve 13500 persons. The work on the new plant commenced in September 1984 and the work is due for completion in September 1986 although it is ahead of schedule at present. The consultant engineers are Balfours of London and the civil engineers responsible are Henry Boot.
